moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nc3: Closed Sicilian, I don't play it very frequent but find it a solid choice
moves.9... Na5 10. Nxf6+: exchanging with tempo, the idea is to play Bd5 next avoiding the disturbance of my pawn structure
moves.10... Bxf6 11. Bd5 Nc6 12. Be3 Be6 13. B: and now is black that will have his pawn structure disturbed - Although necessarily not a bad thing as we will see in the end of the game as he does has a central majority, that he will be able to exploit latter on
moves.13... fxe6 14. h3: the idea is to get my knight to h2 then g4, but what was achieved by this? maybe here Qd2
moves.14... Qe7 15. a3: again with nothing to do push the a and h pawns... no plan what so ever
moves.15... a5 16. Rc1: to prepare the central pawn break
moves.16... b6 17. d4: and trying to do a central pawn break...
moves.17... exd4 18. cxd4 Rad8 19. Qb3: ? allowing black to keep an extra pawn
moves.19... Nxd4 20. Bxd4 cxd4 21. Rc6: leaving black with one pawn up and central pawn majority I never knew what was coming...
moves.21... Qf7 22. Re1: trying to defend my last hope the e4 pawn
moves.22... h6: some escape square for his king
moves.23. Rxb6 e5: and now I started to think I can draw this game...
moves.24. Qb5 Rd7 25. Rc1: to passive why not Qxa5 to get some counter-play
moves.26. Rb8 Rdd8 27. Rb7 Qg6 28. exd5: and a final mistake... the following moves are just played in disbelieve... how could this just had gone so wrong...
